title: Authors and Citation
text: Brancen Gregory. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gregory B (2025). secretmanager: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets R. R package version 0.0.1, https://brancengregory.github.io/secretmanager/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {secretmanager: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R},   author = {Brancen Gregory},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://brancengregory.github.io/secretmanager/}, }

what: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: R package interacting Google Cloud Secret Manager, providing secure way manage access secrets R applications.

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: can install development version secretmanager GitHub using:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("brancengregory/secretmanager")

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: package uses gargle package authentication Google Cloud services. using package, ’ll need : Set authentication credentials Google Cloud Ensure necessary permissions access Secret Manager

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: three ways authenticate Google Cloud Secret Manager:

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
code: library(secretmanager) library(gargle)  # Define required scopes and fetch token scopes <- c("https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform") token <- gargle::token_fetch(scopes = scopes)  # Initialize the package with the token secretmanager_auth(token = token)

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
code: library(secretmanager) library(gargle)  # This will open a browser window for authentication gargle::credentials_app_default()

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: Choose authentication method best fits use case. explicit token method provides control, application default credentials convenient local development, service account keys useful automated environments.
code: library(secretmanager) library(gargle)  # Set the path to your service account key file gargle::credentials_service_account(   path = "path/to/service-account-key.json" )

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: ’s basic example use package:
code: library(secretmanager)  project <- "test-project"  secrets <- list_secrets(project)  secret_version_latest(secrets[1], project)  create_secret(   project_id = project,   secret_id = "test-secret" )  add_secret_version(   project_id = project,   secret_id = "test-secret",   payload = "Shhhhhh, i'm a secret--don't tell!" )

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: Secure access Google Cloud Secret Manager Easy integration gargle authentication Support creating, reading, updating, deleting secrets Base64 encoding/decoding secret values Comprehensive error handling

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: package uses following development tools: testthat testing roxygen2 documentation renv dependency management

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: Contributions welcome! Please feel free submit Pull Request.

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: package handles sensitive information. Please ensure : Secrets may printed R console live logs Never commit credentials secrets version control Use appropriate access controls Google Cloud Follow security best practices handling secrets

title: Manage Google Cloud Platform Secrets with R
text: encounter issues questions, please: Check documentation Review gargle documentation Open issue

title: Add a Secret Version — add_secret_version
text: Adds new version existing secret.

title: Add a Secret Version — add_secret_version
code: add_secret_version(project_id, secret_id, payload, etag = NULL)

title: Add a Secret Version — add_secret_version
text: project_id Google Cloud Project ID. secret_id ID secret version added. payload secret data (raw vector character string). etag Optional. optimistic concurrency control.

title: Add a Secret Version — add_secret_version
text: list containing information newly created secret version.

title: Add a Secret Version — add_secret_version
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Add a new version with string data add_secret_version(   project_id = "your-gcp-project-id",   secret_id = "my-secret",   payload = "my-new-secret-value" )  # Add a new version with raw data add_secret_version(   project_id = "your-gcp-project-id",   secret_id = "my-secret",   payload = charToRaw("binary_data") ) } # }

what: Create a Google Cloud Secret — create_secret
title: Create a Google Cloud Secret — create_secret
text: Creates new secret specified Google Cloud Project.

title: Create a Google Cloud Secret — create_secret
code: create_secret(   project_id,   secret_id,   labels = NULL,   replication_policy = NULL,   etag = NULL,   ttl = NULL )

title: Create a Google Cloud Secret — create_secret
text: project_id Google Cloud Project ID. secret_id ID secret create. Must unique within project. labels Optional. list key-value pairs attach labels secret. replication_policy Optional. list defining replication policy. example, list(automatic = list()) automatic replication, list(userManaged = list(replicas = list(list(location = "us-east1")))) user-managed replication "us-east1". etag Optional. optimistic concurrency control. ttl Optional. TTL (Time--Live) secret. Must string representing duration, e.g., "3600s" 1 hour.

title: Create a Google Cloud Secret — create_secret
text: list containing information newly created secret.

title: Create a Google Cloud Secret — create_secret
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ secret_info <- create_secret(   project_id = "your-gcp-project-id",   secret_id = "my-new-secret",   labels = list(environment = "development"),   replication_policy = list(automatic = list()) ) print(secret_info) } # }

title: List Google Cloud Secrets — list_secrets
text: Retrieves list secrets within specified Google Cloud Project. function leverages authentication configured via secretmanager_auth().

title: List Google Cloud Secrets — list_secrets
code: list_secrets(project_id, filter = NULL)

title: List Google Cloud Secrets — list_secrets
text: project_id Google Cloud Project ID. filter Optional. filter expression narrow results. See Google Cloud Secret Manager documentation filter syntax.

title: List Google Cloud Secrets — list_secrets
text: list containing information secrets project.

title: List Google Cloud Secrets — list_secrets
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Ensure you've authenticated, e.g., via: # secretmanager_auth() # or with a specific token: # token <- gargle::token_fetch(scopes = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform") # secretmanager_auth(token = token)  # Replace 'your-gcp-project-id' with your actual project ID my_secrets <- list_secrets(project_id = "your-gcp-project-id") print(my_secrets) } # }

what: Retrieve the configured API key — secretmanager_api_key
title: Retrieve the configured API key — secretmanager_api_key
text: Returns currently configured API key secretmanager package. Note: API keys limited use Secret Manager, primarily relies OAuth2.0.

title: Retrieve the configured API key — secretmanager_api_key
code: secretmanager_api_key()

title: Retrieve the configured API key — secretmanager_api_key
text: string containing API key, NULL key configured.

title: Retrieve the configured API key — secretmanager_api_key
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Configure API key first (if applicable) # secretmanager_auth_configure(api_key = "YOUR_API_KEY") key <- secretmanager_api_key() if (!is.null(key)) {   print(key) } } # }

what: Authenticate with Google Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth
title: Authenticate with Google Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth
text: function handles authentication Google Cloud Secret Manager. called automatically first token needed, can called directly user pre-authenticate switch identities, scopes, authentication methods (e.g., user OAuth, service account token). Following gargle best practices sensitive APIs, secretmanager come built-OAuth client API key. must configure via secretmanager_auth_configure() provide service account token via path argument.

title: Authenticate with Google Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth
code: secretmanager_auth(   email = gargle::gargle_oauth_email(),   path = NULL,   scopes = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/secretmanager",   cache = gargle::gargle_oauth_cache(),   use_oob = gargle::gargle_oob_default(),   token = NULL )

title: Authenticate with Google Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth
text: email Optional. email address Google identity want authenticate . Useful selecting specific account multiple, non-interactive authentication. NULL, gargle try obtain "gargle_oauth_email" option allow choose list interactive sessions. See gargle::gargle_oauth_email() details. path Optional. Path service account token (JSON file) pre-existing token. provided, used authentication instead OAuth flow. See gargle::token_fetch() details accepted formats. scopes OAuth scopes request. Secret Manager, common scope "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/secretmanager" broader "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform". Defaults "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/secretmanager". cache location OAuth token cache. Defaults gargle::gargle_oauth_cache(). use_oob Whether prefer "--band" (OOB) authentication. Defaults gargle::gargle_oob_default(). Useful non-interactive sessions browser easily launched. token pre-existing token object (e.g., httr::Token2.0 another gargle-using package). provided, token used directly.

title: Authenticate with Google Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth
text: Invisibly returns NULL. main effect configure authentication state package.

title: Authenticate with Google Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # To configure your own OAuth client (do this once per project/user): secretmanager_auth_configure(  path = "/path/to/your/oauth-client-secret.json" )  # Authenticate (often not needed explicitly, called by API functions): secretmanager_auth()  # Authenticate with a specific user: secretmanager_auth(email = "my_user@example.com")  # Authenticate using a service account: secretmanager_auth(path = "/path/to/your/service-account-key.json")  # Authenticate using a pre-fetched token (like googleCloudStorageR example): token <- gargle::token_fetch(   scopes = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform" ) secretmanager_auth(token = token) } # }

what: Configure OAuth client and API key for Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth_configure
title: Configure OAuth client and API key for Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth_configure
text: function allows advanced users provide OAuth client ID secret (JSON file downloaded Google Cloud Console) API key. OAuth Client: secretmanager, providing OAuth client highly recommended package ship default client due sensitive nature API. API Key: gargle framework supports API keys, Secret Manager operations require OAuth2.0 authentication. API key might useful limited, typically read-, public data scenarios, rare Secret Manager. included structural consistency gargle may limited direct use package.

title: Configure OAuth client and API key for Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth_configure
code: secretmanager_auth_configure(   path = NULL,   client = NULL,   api_key = NULL,   app = NULL )

title: Configure OAuth client and API key for Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth_configure
text: path Path JSON file containing OAuth client ID secret. recommended way configure OAuth client. client httr::oauth_app object gargle::gargle_oauth_client object. Alternatively, provide path. api_key string representing Google Cloud API key. app Deprecated. Use client instead.

title: Configure OAuth client and API key for Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth_configure
text: Invisibly returns updated auth configuration (AuthState object).

title: Configure OAuth client and API key for Secret Manager — secretmanager_auth_configure
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Configure with an OAuth client downloaded from GCP secretmanager_auth_configure(   path = "/path/to/your/oauth-client-secret.json" )  # To configure with an API key (less common for Secret Manager): # secretmanager_auth_configure(api_key = "YOUR_API_KEY")  # Check configured client: secretmanager_oauth_client() } # }

title: De-authenticate from Secret Manager — secretmanager_deauth
text: Clears current Secret Manager token. means next API request requires authentication trigger authentication process anew (e.g., calling secretmanager_auth()). Since Secret Manager generally requires authentication significant operations (typically use API keys accessing secrets), de-authentication primarily serves clear current user's session force re-authentication.

title: De-authenticate from Secret Manager — secretmanager_deauth
code: secretmanager_deauth()

title: De-authenticate from Secret Manager — secretmanager_deauth
text: Invisibly returns NULL.

title: De-authenticate from Secret Manager — secretmanager_deauth
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ secretmanager_deauth() # Next API call will re-trigger auth # list_secrets() # (Assuming this is a function in your package) } # }

title: Secret Manager Endpoint — secretmanager_endpoint
text: Secret Manager Endpoint

title: Secret Manager Endpoint — secretmanager_endpoint
code: secretmanager_endpoint(i)

title: Secret Manager Endpoint — secretmanager_endpoint
text: index endpoint

title: List Secret Manager endpoints — secretmanager_endpoints
text: secretmanager package stores named list Secret Manager API v1 endpoints ("methods", using Google's vocabulary) internally functions expose data. secretmanager_endpoint() returns one endpoint, .e. uses [[. secretmanager_endpoints() returns list endpoints, .e. uses [. names list (id sub-elements) nicknames can used specify endpoint request_generate(). endpoint, store nickname id, associated HTTP verb, path, details parameters. list derived programmatically Secret Manager API v1 Discovery Document (https://www.googleapis.com/discovery/v1/apis/secretmanager/v1/rest) using approach described Discovery Documents section gargle vignette Request helper functions.

title: List Secret Manager endpoints — secretmanager_endpoints
code: secretmanager_endpoints(i = NULL)

title: List Secret Manager endpoints — secretmanager_endpoints
text: name(s) integer index(ices) endpoints return. optional secretmanager_endpoints() , given, entire list returned.

title: List Secret Manager endpoints — secretmanager_endpoints
text: One Secret Manager API v1 endpoints used internally secretmanager.

title: List Secret Manager endpoints — secretmanager_endpoints

Rotation policy attached to the Secret. May be excluded if there is no rotation policy." #>  #> $parameters$rotation$`$ref` #> [1] "Rotation" #>  #> $parameters$rotation$location #> [1] "body" #>  #>  #> $parameters$versionAliases #> $parameters$versionAliases$description #> [1] "Optional. Mapping from version alias to version name. A version alias is a string with a maximum length of 63 characters and can contain uppercase and lowercase letters, numerals, and the hyphen (`-`) and underscore ('_') characters. An alias string must start with a letter and cannot be the string 'latest' or 'NEW'. No more than 50 aliases can be assigned to a given secret. Version-Alias pairs will be viewable via GetSecret and modifiable via UpdateSecret. Access by alias is only be supported on GetSecretVersion and AccessSecretVersion." #>  #> $parameters$versionAliases$type #> [1] "object" #>  #> $parameters$versionAliases$additionalProperties #> $parameters$versionAliases$additionalProperties$type #> [1] "string" #>  #> $parameters$versionAliases$additionalProperties$format #> [1] "int64" #>  #>  #> $parameters$versionAliases$location #> [1] "body" #>  #>  #> $parameters$annotations #> $parameters$annotations$description #> [1] "Optional. Custom metadata about the secret. Annotations are distinct from various forms of labels. Annotations exist to allow client tools to store their own state information without requiring a database. Annotation keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long, have a UTF-8 encoding of maximum 128 bytes, begin and end with an alphanumeric character ([a-z0-9A-Z]), and may have dashes (-), underscores (_), dots (.), and alphanumerics in between these symbols. The total size of annotation keys and values must be less than 16KiB." #>  #> $parameters$annotations$type #> [1] "object" #>  #> $parameters$annotations$additionalProperties #> $parameters$annotations$additionalProperties$type #> [1] "string" #>  #>  #> $parameters$annotations$location #> [1] "body" #>  #>  #> $parameters$versionDestroyTtl #> $parameters$versionDestroyTtl$description #> [1] "Optional. Secret Version TTL after destruction request This is a part of the Delayed secret version destroy feature. For secret with TTL>0, version destruction doesn't happen immediately on calling destroy instead the version goes to a disabled state and destruction happens after the TTL expires." #>  #> $parameters$versionDestroyTtl$type #> [1] "string" #>  #> $parameters$versionDestroyTtl$format #> [1] "google-duration" #>  #> $parameters$versionDestroyTtl$location #> [1] "body" #>  #>  #> $parameters$customerManagedEncryption #> $parameters$customerManagedEncryption$description #> [1] "Optional. The customer-managed encryption configuration of the regionalized secrets. If no configuration is provided, Google-managed default encryption is used. Updates to the Secret encryption configuration only apply to SecretVersions added afterwards. text: Logical. TRUE token available, FALSE otherwise.

text: gargle_oauth_client object, NULL client configured.

title: Retrieve the configured OAuth client — secretmanager_oauth_client
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Configure client first # secretmanager_auth_configure(path = "/path/to/your/client.json") client <- secretmanager_oauth_client() if (!is.null(client)) {   print(client) } } # }

what: Provide a token for Secret Manager API requests — secretmanager_token
title: Provide a token for Secret Manager API requests — secretmanager_token
text: Retrieves current token Secret Manager. authentication active (.auth$auth_active TRUE) token cached, trigger secretmanager_auth() obtain one. function typically used package functions make API requests.

code: secretmanager_token()

title: Provide a token for Secret Manager API requests — secretmanager_token
text: httr::config object containing httr::Token2.0 object, NULL auth inactive.

title: Provide a token for Secret Manager API requests — secretmanager_token
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Configure auth first if needed (e.g., with your client ID) # secretmanager_auth_configure(path = "path/to/client.json") # secretmanager_auth() # or let it be called automatically  token <- secretmanager_token() if (!is.null(token)) {   # Use token in httr::GET() or other API calls } } # }

title: Get information about the authenticated user — secretmanager_user
text: list containing user information (e.g., email) NULL token available user information parsed.

title: Get information about the authenticated user — secretmanager_user
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Authenticate first # secretmanager_auth()  user_info <- secretmanager_user() if (!is.null(user_info)) {   print(user_info$email) } } # }
